0.txt: These brownies are unlike any you have tasted!
0.Complete: These brownies are unlike any brownies  you have tasted!

1.txt: They use not only brownie batter, but cookie dough and Oreos as well.

2.txt: And best of all, they're incredibly easy to make!
2.Complete: And best of all, brownies are incredibly easy to make!

3.txt: You'll only need about 45 minutes from start to consumption.

5.txt:
You'll need:1 3 dozen chocolate chip cookie mix 1 13x9 brownie mix 1 package of Double Stuf Oreos 1 tablespoon of olive oil 1/2 cup of water 1 stick of butter 2 eggs
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.

6.txt: Don't forget to wash your hands!

7.txt: Follow the instructions on the back of your cookie mix.

8.txt: For this specific package, we started by pouring the mix into a large mixing bowl.

9.txt: Next, we added 1 stick of softened butter to the mix.
9.Co-reference: Next, we added 1 stick of softened butter to it.

10.Ellipsis: :Lastly, we added 1 egg to the mix.

11.txt: We then mixed the dough ingredients together until it was a soft, doughy consistency.
11.Complete: We then mixed the dough ingredients together until mix was a soft, doughy consistency.

12.txt: First, grease the pan with Pam or a similar oil spray to prevent the dessert from sticking.

13.txt: Then smush the cookie dough into the bottom of your 13x9 pan.
13.Co-reference: Then smush the cookie dough into the bottom of it.

14.txt: Make sure the cookie dough covers the entire surface.
14.Co-reference: Make sure it covers the entire surface.

15.txt: Now, add the Double Stuf Oreos to the pan.
15.Co-reference: Now, add the Double Stuf Oreos to it.

16.txt: Simply lay down the Oreos to create a single layer on top of the cookie dough.
16.Co-reference: Simply lay down the Oreos to create a single layer on top of it.

17.txt: For our third component, follow the instructions on the back of your 13x9 brownie mix.

18.txt: For this specific mix, we first poured the dry brownie mix into a large mixing bowl.

19.txt: We then added the 1/2 cup of water, 1 tablespoon of olive oil, and 1 egg.
19.Complete: We then added the 1/2 cup of water to large mixing bowl, 1 tablespoon of olive oil to large mixing bowl, and 1 egg to large mixing bowl.

20.txt: Stir the mix until it is a creamy consistency.
20.Complete: Stir the mix until  mix is a creamy consistency.

21.txt: Pour the brownie batter on top of the Oreo layer.

22.txt: Spread out the batter to cover all of the Oreos.
22.Co-reference: Spread out the batter to cover all of it.

23.txt: Gently shake the pan from side to side on the counter to even out all of the mix.

24.txt: Put the Oreo Cookie Brownies into the oven, and set a timer for 30 minutes.
24.Co-reference: Put it into the oven, and set a timer for 30 minutes.

25.txt: Remove the dessert from the oven once the timer is up.
25.Co-reference: Remove the dessert from the there once the timer is up.

26.txt: Be sure to protect your hands from the heat!

27.txt: Cut the dessert into any shape you prefer.

28.txt: I usually cut them into 1-Oreo-sized portions.
28.Co-reference: I usually cut dessert into 1-Oreo-sized portions.
